{"step_by_step_thinking": "The dental pulp is the part of the tooth that contains nerves, blood vessels, and connective tissue. It is responsible for the nutrition of the tooth, but it also plays a role in the production of dentin, which is the hard tissue that forms the bulk of the tooth. The dental pulp does not produce enamel, which is the hard, outer layer of the tooth. The vascular supply to the teeth is also an important function of the dental pulp, but it is not the primary function.", "answer_choice": "B. Production of dentin"}
